text.section: The Governor may amend an appropriation for a program of the Office of the Governor.

section.section: Except as provided in § 7-212 of this subtitle, whenever an officer or unit of the Executive Branch of the State government wants the appropriation for a program of the officer or unit amended, the officer or unit shall submit a proposed amended appropriation for the program to the Secretary of Budget and Management.

The Secretary of Budget and Management shall endorse on or attach to the proposed amended appropriation for the program a recommendation and send the amended appropriation for the program and recommendation to the Governor.
At any time before the Governor approves or disapproves the proposed amended appropriation for a program, the officer or unit may withdraw the proposal.
Whenever the Governor approves a proposed amended appropriation for a program, the Governor shall endorse it as "approved".

An amendment of an appropriation for a program:
except as provided in paragraph (2) of this subsection, may not increase the sum of the appropriations from the General Fund of the State for all the programs of the officer or unit; and
may permit the expenditure of money from a special fund or the federal government as provided in § 2-201 of this article or § 7-217(a) of this subtitle.

An amendment of an appropriation for a program of the Executive Branch may increase the sum of the appropriations from the General Fund of the State for all programs of the officer or unit if moneys from the Contingent Fund of the Board of Public Works are transferred to the program.
Except as provided in paragraph (2) of this subsection, an amendment under this section may not increase a salary so that it exceeds the amount set by the most recently enacted State budget.
The limitation in this paragraph applies whether or not the most recently enacted budget is in effect.
If the Board of Public Works approves the increase, the Governor may approve an amendment that increases the salary for a position listed in the budget bill in accordance with § 7-109 of this title.
An amendment under this paragraph remains effective until the State budget for the next fiscal year becomes effective.

Except as provided in paragraphs (2) and (3) of this subsection, an amendment under this section may not transfer any part of an appropriation among any of the principal departments or any of the units in the Executive Branch that are not assigned to a principal department.

A copy of each approved budget amendment under this paragraph shall be provided to the Department of Legislative Services.

text.section:
The Governor shall send a copy of each amended appropriation for a program to:
the Comptroller; and
the Department of Legislative Services.
An amended appropriation for a program is effective when the Governor sends notice of the amended appropriation to the Comptroller.
